definition: surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites
respectfully yours (at the end of a letter)

sentences.english: So he prostrated and praised the Guru for such great favors.
sentences.chinese: 所以他敬礼与称赞上师给予他如斯大恩。

sentences.english: The sergeant brought the guards to attention and saluted the inspection officer.
sentences.chinese: 中士令卫队立正并向检阅官敬礼。

sentences.english: The soldier clicked his heels and saluted.
sentences.chinese: 那个兵两脚跟咔嗒一声，立正敬礼。

sentences.english: Students see teacher seven meters outside to salute.
sentences.chinese: 学生见到老师七米外要敬礼。

sentences.english: The policeman would stand and salute.
sentences.chinese: 这时，警察就会肃立敬礼。
士兵们向军官举手敬礼。

sentences.english: I told the scouts to stop saluting me,” he said.
sentences.chinese: 他说，“我告诉巡防队员不必朝我敬礼。

sentences.english: Salutations, black earth, be strong and alert.
sentences.chinese: 敬礼，黑色的大地，强壮而又机警。

sentences.english: The guard saluted the officer in the car.
sentences.chinese: 警卫向车上的军官敬礼。

sentences.english: In comparison, Huangping County’s policy of roadside salutes is arguably benign.
sentences.chinese: 相比之下，黄平县的路上敬礼并不那么恶劣。
我向一个无名之辈敬礼。

sentences.english: The sergeant brought the guard smartly to attention and saluted the inspecting officer.
sentences.chinese: 班长令卫队立正并向检阅官敬礼。

definition: to send one's greetings/to send best regards/to devote attention to
to stand respectfully/(of trees, mountains) standing tall and majestic
to say hello to/to send one's regards to
to return a greeting/to send a gift in return
senior official/senior officer/commanding officer/CL:位[wei4]/sir (term of address for senior officer)
